questions.title: What technologies do you use to deliver patient care?

choices: Patient identification, booking, and registration systems
Electronic prescription and medication management systems
Electronic laboratory and diagnostic imaging management
Mobile phones, health apps and online resources
Do not use technologies to deliver healthcare

questions.title: How would you describe your organisation when they adopt digital technologies?

elements.name: How would you describe your organisation when they adopt digital technologies?
choices: Active adopter - one of the first to actively adopt digital solutions
Early supporter - early supporter of using digital solutions
Early majority – adopter of digital solutions after a brief trial period
Late majority – adopter of digital solutions after a long trial period
Laggard – one of the last to adopt digital solutions

conditionalLogic.condition: Laggard – one of the last to adopt digital solutions

conditionalQuestion.title: If you identify your organisation as slow to adopt technologies (i.e. laggard), please provide a reason why.

elements.name: If you identify your organisation as slow to adopt technologies (i.e. laggard), please provide a reason why.

questions.title: When it comes to incorporating digital health into your day-to-day activities, what barriers do you face?
questions.none: I have not personally experienced any barriers

elements.name: When it comes to incorporating digital health into your day-to-day activities, what barriers do you face?
choices: Lack of integration with existing systems and processes (including models of care)
Access to latest digital health tools and technologies
I have not personally experienced any barriers

questions.title: What populations do you provide services for that face barriers to healthcare?

elements.name: What populations do you provide services for that face barriers to healthcare?
choices: Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander person
Multicultural or Culturally and Linguistically Diverse (CALD) person
Lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, intersex, queer and other sexuality and gender diverse (LGBTIQ+) person
Person living in regional, rural or remote areas
Person living with a specific condition(s)

Other (e.g. prenatal care, child health and reproductive health)
